entry.title: Seven Natural Wonders of the UK (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a survey found that only 10 per cent of Britons had heard of all Seven Natural Wonders of the UK (one pictured)?

entry.title: Ann Kiemel Anderson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that American religious speaker Ann Kiemel Anderson ran in two Boston Marathons and two Israel marathons near the Sea of Galilee to promote Christianity?

entry.title: Colonia Federal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the neighborhood of Colonia Federal was built by employees of the Mexican Secretariat of the Interior to create exclusive housing for civil servants?

entry.title: Robert Armour (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Robert Armour was entrusted with his children's inheritance from his dead wife, but used it to buy the Montreal Gazette instead?

entry.title: University of Arizona radio bureau (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1951, the University of Arizona radio bureau produced four different programs that aired on four different Tucson stations?

entry.title: Alice King (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Alice King overcame her disability to lead Bible classes and write eleven novels?

entry.title: the Sofia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Sofia, a condominium building in New York City, was originally a parking garage?

entry.title: 2000 Pasay mayoral recall election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the "candidate of God" badly lost the 2000 Pasay mayoral recall election?
